page.title: 20West Sunderland Farm.
page.content: Mr Smith originally owned this farm but it was then purchased by a Mr Kidman and has since then been passed down from generation to generation. The farm is now run by a Mr Reynolds who is the foreman. The farm is 270 acres in size and has 3 fields of wheat and one of barley. There were hedges on the farm but these have been removed to make way for cultivated land. There are 2 barns on the farm, one contains machinery the other a large corn drier. At harvest time extra labour arrives at the farm from one of Mr Kidmans other farms near St Neots. During the rest of the year there is no need for many men as the land is given over to crops which require little attention.
